content: 13 change to blue yarn slip the first stitch then knit this round round 14 knit with blue yarn copyright joy macdonell not for distribution or duplication 2 round 15 repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 16 knit with blue yarn round 17 k1 blue k1 white repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 18 knit with blue yarn round 19 repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 20 knit with blue yarn round 21 k1 blue k1 white repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 22 knit with blue yarn round 23 repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 24 knit with blue yarn round 25 k1 blue k1 white repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 26 knit with blue yarn round 27 repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 28 knit with blue yarn round 29 k1 blue k1 white repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 30 knit with blue yarn round 31 repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 32 knit with blue yarn round 33 k1 blue k1 white repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 34 knit with blue yarn round 35 repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 36 knit with blue yarn round 37 k1 blue k1 white repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 38 knit with blue yarn round 39 repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 40 knit with blue yarn round 41 k1 blue k1 white repeat pattern k3 blue k1 white to end of round round 42 knit with blue yarn round 43 knit with blue yarn kitchener stitch to finish hat step 1 you are done knitting your hat it is time to weave the front and back together leave all stitches on your needles measure about 36 inches of your working yarn and cut the yarn from the skein step 2 thread the yarn onto a tapestry needle and follow the below instructions for the kitchener stitch you are creating knit stitches as you weave the yarn through the live knit stitches if the written instructions are difficult to understand take a moment to watch the demonstration of the kitchener stitch on the video once you get the rhythm this is a quick and easy way to seam your hat your tapestry needle will go into the stitches knit-wise or purl-wise copyright joy macdonell not for distribution or duplication 3 follow these four steps until you have one stitch on each needle 1 enter the first stitch on the front needle as if to knit take that stitch off the needle 2 enter the second stitch on the front needle as if to purl leave the stitch on the needle pull
